thread.title: Couple recreate La La Land scenes for engagement photo shoot
thread.title_full: Couple recreate La La Land scenes for engagement photo shoot

author: Adam Boult
title: Couple recreate La La Land scenes for engagement photo shoot
text:
Couple recreate La La Land scenes for engagement photo shoot Ellen Wleklinski and Corey Collins recreate a scene from La La Land Credit: M. Hart Photography/Marlies Hartmann Adam Boult  09pm 
W hen newly-engaged couple Ellen Wleklinski and Corey Collins decided to have a professional photo shoot to commemorate their happy news, photographer Marlies Hartmann helped them come up with the perfect theme - La La Land . 
Dressing as the film's central characters Mia and Sebastian, played by Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, the pair visited a number of locations featured in the film, while Ms Hartmann set about recreating some of the magic and atmosphere of the Oscar-nominated movie. Credit: M. Hart Photography/Marlies Hartmann 
L ike the couple in the film, Californians Wleklinski and Corey met in Los Angeles, and went on one of their first dates to the Griffith Observatory - location of one of La La Land's spectacular dance sequence. Credit: M. Hart Photography/Marlies Hartmann 
"We knew that our goal was to re-create and evoke the energy and feeling from the film, as well as portray the images as if the characters had indeed gotten their 'Hollywood' happily-ever-after ending we all hoped for when watching the movie," photographer Marlies Hartmann told Pop Sugar . 

"My favorite part about the shoot was the real-life chemistry between Ellen and Corey!" she added. "They are effervescent as a couple, full of the same kind of zest for life and contagious energy as Mia and Sebastian. Credit: M. Hart Photography/Marlies Hartmann 
"They made the whole shoot light up just by being themselves, wildly in love and nuts about each other in that timeless, Old Hollywood sort of way." 
L a La Land is nominated in 14 categories in this year's Academy Awards, including Best Picture, Best Screenplay and Best Director. Credit: M. Hart Photography/Marlies Hartmann 
T he Telegraph's Robbie Collin gave the film a five star review , saying: "It sends you from the cinema with tears in your eyes, a song in your heart, and a clear six inches of thin air between the soles of your shoes and the pavement." Follow Telegraph Entertainment
